intro: Gutierrezia texana, commonly known as Texas greenbriar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small yellow daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as sandy soils and rocky areas, thriving in arid environments. Its leaves are usually small, narrow, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often branching and thorny. Gutierrezia texana is also known for its ability to produce a resinous substance, which can be used in traditional herbal remedies.
